subject: Economics
title: State Capacity: Why Some Governments Work and Others Don't
description: One-minute skill: State Capacity: Why Some Governments Work and Others Don't.

hook.text: Denmark collects 46% of GDP in taxes. The Democratic Republic of Congo collects 7%.

buildup.text: State capacity: the government's ability to implement policies, collect taxes, enforce laws, and deliver services.

discovery.text: Weak states can't build roads, run schools, or enforce contracts.

twist.text: Too much state capacity without accountability creates tyranny.

climax.text: Development requires building state capacity â€” but gradually, with accountability.

punchline.text: Good government isn't about size. It's about capability plus accountability.

quiz.question: What is 'state capacity' in development economics?
options: The size of the government building
The government's ability to effectively implement policies, collect taxes, enforce laws, and deliver public services
How many employees a government has
